body.p: Oracc Gudea covers the signs used in Gudea Cylinders A and B.
Oracc Gudea is based on the Gudea Cylinder copies in F. Thureau-Dangin, Les Cylindres de Goudéa Découverts Par Ernest de Sarzec à Tello. (Textes Cunéiformes, Musée Du Louvre 8 [=TCL 8]). Paris, 1925.

The characters were excerpted and converted from PNG format to SVG and then to a TrueType font using a collection of tools by various authors and assembled into a workflow by Steve Tinney in a package available on GitHub as Santak.
Oracc Gudea is licensed under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1.
All of the Oracc fonts are downloadable from the Oracc II GitHub repository in the msc/fonts subdirectory.
In Oracc projects the font is selected with the CSS class ofs-gudea.
